#Text=Manage Parenting
#Text=Burnout
#Text=Burnout is common in any job .
#Text=Sometimes , you feel stressed out , anxious and overworked , and you begin to wonder whether the job is a good fit for you and your life .
#Text=The job of parenting is not one you can resign from , however .
#Text=You are responsible for your children until they become adults , no matter how needy they get or how underappreciated you may feel .
#Text=Parenting burnout can cause major problems in your life , so make sure you identify and address it immediately .
#Text=Manage parenting burnout by adjusting your expectations , balancing your kids ' needs with your own and leaning on your support network for help .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Recognize the signs of parenting burnout .
#Text=Notice when you are feeling irritable or extra sensitive .
#Text=This may manifest itself even outside of your children .
#Text=You may have no patience at work or at school , and you might find yourself snapping at or testy with people .
#Text=Pay attention to any feelings of resentment .
#Text=You might also feel guilt , anger , frustration and feelings of inadequacy .
#Text=You could feel like you have no control over your life .
#Text=Observe detachment from your children , or a lack of interest in the things you normally enjoy .
#Text=Parents who are extremely stressed or burned out might pull away from their kids and not be as present with them .
#Text=Evaluate what you expect from yourself .
#Text=You might put too much pressure on yourself as a parent .
#Text=Remember that most experts agree that consistent parenting is better than super parenting .
#Text=You do not have to be perfect .
#Text=Take care of yourself first .
#Text=You cannot care for your kids if you are not taking care of yourself .
#Text=Make sure you get enough rest , exercise and nutrition .
#Text=Think about the " oxygen rule " on airplanes .

column1: #Text=Parents are instructed to put on their own oxygen masks before giving oxygen to their kids .
#Text=This is because you cannot help your kids if you are not okay .
#Text=Slow down .
#Text=Manage parenting burnout by working on your pace throughout the day .
#Text=Not everything needs to be urgent .
#Text=Stop comparing yourself to others .
#Text=Do not aspire to be like your neighbors or friends .
#Text=You ca n't know for sure what is really going on in their lives .
#Text=Let people help you .
#Text=A good support network is a great tool to help you manage parenting burnout .
#Text=Hire babysitters .
#Text=Leave the kids with a reliable babysitter so you can have a few hours to yourself .
#Text=Or , to save funds , do a babysitting swap with another mom so you both get some kid-free time .
#Text=Talk to your spouse , friends and other parents .
#Text=Talking about your stress and feelings of burnout will help you make sense of it .
#Text=Sharing with other parents will help you feel less alone .
#Text=Consider therapy .
#Text=If your stress and burnout seems out of control , talk to a therapist or a counselor .
#Text=They can help you get to the root of your problems , and give you additional tools to manage burnout .
#Text=Focus on the positive .
#Text=It can be difficult to think positively when you are emotionally drained , but it will help you keep things in perspective .
#Text=Keep a journal .
#Text=Take a few minutes every day to write about your feelings .
#Text=It can help you release your negative energy , and give you a space to focus on and write about your positive thoughts .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Look for a support network that has regular meetings and play groups .
#Text=This is especially important for parents with special challenges , including single parents or parents of children with disabilities such as autism or ADHD .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Remember that parenting burnout can sometimes lead to depression or more serious mental illnesses .
#Text=If you find you cannot manage to overcome your burnout and the stress and anxiety of parenting seem overwhelming , get help immediately .
#Text=Call your doctor , 911 or a mental health professional , especially if you are having thoughts of harming yourself or others .
